bibl.title: Letter from J. F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, February 11, 1954

div1.p: Siler thanks Hench for providing a check to enable delivery of the Finlay Medals, but informs him that the Walter Reed Memorial Association wishes to fund this objective.

div1.head: Letter from J. F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, February 11, 1954
div1.opener:
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
-----
GORGAS MEMORIAL LABORATORY
JOSEPH F. SILER
PRESIDENT
MAURICE H. THATCHER
VICE PRESIDENT AND GENERAL COUNSEL
WALTER A. BLOEDORN
SECRETARY
EXECUTIVE OFFICES
1835 EYE STREET. NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6. D. C.
February 11, 1954
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn
My dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
This will acknowledge receipt of your two letters of February 2nd, one
of which enclosed your check for $245.00 for payment for Finlay medallions for
the relatives of those who participated in the yellow fever work. It was
wonderful of you to offer to pay for the medals to be sent to these various
people in the United States.

A number of the members of the Board of the Walter Reed Memorial Association
have talked over this matter and we feel very strongly that because of the
immense amount of work which you have done in connection with the establishment
of this Memorial and its dedication that the Walter Reed Memorial Association
should be responsible for payment of the cost of these mdeallions. Several of
us have agreed unanimously that this should be done.

I have consulted with Mr. Ireland and he told me that in addition to the
money needed for sending Blossom Reed the monthly check of $100 there is in the
fund something over $600. In view of that fact, we all agreed that the $245.00
referred to above should be taken from that reserve fund.

Mr. Ireland is sending a check to Dr. Nogueira with a covering letter which
I have signed, copy of which is enclosed.

I am accordingly returning to you with this letter your personal check for
$245.00 which you sent to me.

We all feel that you have done a wonderful thing in bringing to fruition
the establishment of Lazear Park.

Hoping to have the pleasure of seeing you next fall at the next annual
meeting of the Board and with very best regards, I am
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, J. F. Siler J. F. Siler, Col., (MC), USA, Rtd.
President, Board of Managers
Walter Reed Memorial Association
jfs k
(Dr. Hench, Feb. 11, 1954.)
P. S. Referring to your second letter of February 4th, relative to the part taken
by the two ladies who live at the Finca San Jose, Senora Maria Teresa Rojas
and Senorita Lidia Cabrere, in bringing to fruition the dedication of Park
Lazear and their connection with the help extended Walter Reed in his yellow
fever work, I would be delighted to take this matter up with the members of
the Board of Managers and we will communicate with you very shortly concerning
this matter.
J. F. S.
J.F.S.
P.S. 2. Since dictating this letter I have learned that we are to have the
pleasure of seeing you in Washington on February 18th when you are to give
a lecture at Walter Reed Army Medical Center on Cortisone and preparations
and their use in rheumatic conditions.
We shall look forward with very great pleasure to seeing you and I trust
that it will be possible t take definite action concerning Senora Rojas and
Senorita Cabrere at that time.
J. F. S.
